document_title: Granulomatous pharyngitis: Causes, signs, prevention and treatment
subsection_content:
Granulomatous pharyngitis causes dry cough, cough with phlegm and many other unpleasant symptoms
Granulomatous pharyngitis causes notable symptoms, including:(2)
Dry and itchy throat, often having to clear the throat or spit to relieve the itching Appearance of red or pink particles in the throat, protruding higher than the surrounding mucosa Difficulty swallowing, painful swallowing, even when swallowing saliva Cough: Dry cough, cough with phlegm Fever, can be higher than 38 degrees Neck lymph nodes are swollen, stiff, painful Fatigue, loss of appetite.; Dry and itchy throat, often having to clear throat or spit to relieve itching; Appearance of red or pink particles in the throat, protruding higher than the surrounding mucosa; Difficulty swallowing, painful swallowing, even when swallowing saliva; Cough: Dry cough, cough with phlegm; Fever, possibly higher than 38 degrees; Neck lymph nodes, stiffness, pain; Fatigue, loss of appetite.
